sections.heading: Electioneering, defined.(1) Electioneering means the deliberate, visible display or audible or physical dissemination of information for the purpose of advocating for or against:(a) Any candidate for an office on the ballot for the election at which such display or dissemination is occurring;(b) Any
sections.text: Electioneering, defined.(1) Electioneering means the deliberate, visible display or audible or physical dissemination of information for the purpose of advocating for or against:(a) Any candidate for an office on the ballot for the election at which such display or dissemination is occurring;(b) Any officeholder of an elected state constitutional office or federal office at the time of the election at which such display or dissemination is occurring; or(c) Any political party on the ballot for the election at which such display or dissemination is occurring.(2) For purposes of this section, information includes: (a) A candidate's name, likeness, logo, or symbol; (b) a button, hat, pencil, pen, shirt, sign, or sticker containing information described by this section; and (c) audible information or any literature, writing, or drawing referring to a candidate, an officeholder, or a political party described in this section.SourceLaws 2024, LB287, ยง 9.
